summary: This is a Daily Activity Report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 15, 2019. It details staffing shortages, inmate counts, and operational statuses, including noting an inmate placed in the Special Housing Unit for assaulting staff at MDC Brooklyn. The report was created the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, including staff shortages, inmate counts, and management of special housing.

events.title: Inmate Assault on Staff at MDC Brooklyn
events.description: An inmate was placed in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York due to a serious assault on staff at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) in Brooklyn.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: This report is dated August 16, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in the MCC New York facility on August 10, 2019.
The report indicates significant staff shortages across multiple shifts and posts, including Correctional assignments being vacated.
The report notes an inmate was placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) for assaulting staff at MDC Brooklyn.
The total inmate population at MCC New York at the beginning of the morning watch shift on August 15, 2019, was 757.
The document is marked CONFIDENTIAL and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) document set related to the Epstein case.
